results.title: The Owl and the pussycat
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Herbert Ross, Ray Stark and Rastar Productions
results.brief_description: Felix (Segal) and Doris (Streisand) are two mismatched neighbours. Felix is a writer, and Doris a prostitute and performer in the 42nd street flick, “Cycle sluts”. They share the same apartment building and annoyance at each other; such as his incessant typing and her numerous male callers. Despite these difference the two become firm friends, facilitating some pretty amusing dialogue between the clash of cultures and morals. The soundtrack is performed by Blood Sweat and Tears. Alan Alda and Diane Sands played the two title characters in the Broadway production, which is based on the play “The Owl and the pussycat” by Robert Klein.

results.title: Starman
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, Larry Franco and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: An alien (Jeff Bridges) makes a stopover on earth when he encounters the Voyager 2 probe. By masquerading as a human he has the opportunity, if only for a little while, to live like an ordinary man. His arrival is quickly discovered by a young woman (Karen Allen) who develops feelings for the Starman and agrees to assist him in the 2000 mile journey it will take him to get home. Cast includes Charles Martin Smith and Richard Jaeckel.

results.title: Bull Durham
results.creator_credit: Ron Shelton, Mark Burg, Thom Mount and Mount Company
results.brief_description: Kevin Costner, Susan Sarandon and Tim Robbins turn in seriously sexy performances in this sensational baseball comedy. Charged with pulling the Durham Bulls ou of the longest losing streak in Carolina’s Baseball League history, Crash Davis’ (Costner) main challenge is to instruct, insult and inspire Eddie ‘Nuke’ Calvin (Robbins), their indisciplined but bullet-fast pitcher. Sarandon is the team’s groupie-cum-English Lit teacher who becomes the fly in the ointment after she catches Nuke’s eye and begins to distract him from Crash’s tuition with her own slightly bizarre set of off-field rules.

results.title: The Crow
results.creator_credit: Alex Proyas, Jeff Most, Edward Pressman and Crowvision
results.brief_description: There is a legend that when a soul can’t rest, a crow can bring that soul back form the dead, to seek justice and make the wrongs thins right.. In the film which cost him his life, martial arts phenomenon Brandon Lee stars as a superhuman mystical hero who returns from the grave to exact revenge on the killers of his fiancee and himself. The film contains fantastic special effects, awesome action and a dark, cyberpunk setting. Lee was killed on the set accidentally in a manner similar to his father, martial arts legend Bruce Lee, so a stand-in was used to complete the filming.

results.title: The Crow: City of angels
results.creator_credit: Tim Pope, Jeff Most, Edward Pressman and Bad Bird Productions
results.brief_description: Sarah (Mia Kirshner), thought that Eric was the only one to be brought back from the dead to make the wrong things right. In this story from ‘The Crow’ anthology inspired by the character created by James O’Barr, a young father, Ashe (Vincent Perez) and his son are brutally murdered when they witness a gruesome killing. Ashe is brought back to life by the mysterious powers of the Crow, but is also aided by a human, Sarah, who knows about the crow legend. Ashe must seek vengeance on those who killed him so that his soul, and that of his son can be at peace. Also starring Iggy Pop, Richard Brooks and Thomas Jane.

results.title: Brimstone & treacle
results.creator_credit: Richard Loncraine, Kenith Trodd and Namara
results.brief_description: A strange young man, Martin Taylor (Sting), infiltrates his way into the family of a vulnerable middle aged couple Tom and Nora Bates (Joan Plowright and Denholm Elliot). Martin becomes infatuated with their daughter Patricia (Suzanne Hamilton), who has been comatose for 4 years. The part angel, part devil Martin, mysteriously rouses sleeping beauty from her slumber. Adapted from the play by Dennis Potter, this film is bizarre to say the least and was banned by the BBC shortly after being taped.

results.title: Wild target
results.creator_credit: Pierre Salvadori, Philippe Martin and Sharmill Films
results.brief_description: This is a winning black farce and a wistful romantic comedy. Starring seasoned veteran Jean Rochefort as a grave-faced professional hitman who guided by his mother in the family business has reached the pinnacle of his career. He is a control freak and self-improver, meticulous at work and at home and a confirmed bachelor and erstwhile linguist. Hard at work one day he runs into a young man (played by Guillaume Diepardieu) who becomes his reluctant apprentice with hilarious results. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Diabolique
results.creator_credit: Jerremiah Chechik, James G. Robinson, Marvin Worth and Morgan Creek
results.brief_description: Jeremiah Chechik’s remake of the French classic, “Les Diaboliques” by Henri-Georges Clouzot, didn’t quite receive the acclaim of the original. Sharon Stone and Isabelle Adjani star as Nicole and Mia, the long suffering lover and wife of the cruel and manipulative headmaster Guy (Chazz Palminteri). Nicole is angry at being taken for granted and Mia, who suffers from a heart problem, is suicidal over her husband’s infidelity. Together they devise a foolproof scheme to rid their lives of Guy and all seems to have gone to plan until events occur that indicate Guy has survived. Hot on his tail is a disgruntled cop, Kathy Bates, who is sympathetic to the women’s situation but also eager to discover the truth.

results.title: Victim
results.creator_credit: Basil Dearden, Michael Relph and Parkway Films
results.brief_description: Dirk Bogarde stars as Melville Farr, a successful lawyer in this film which caused a sensation at its original release. Farr is approached by police who are looking into the theft of money they suspect is being used as payment for blackmail by Jack Barrett (Peter McEnery). Farr initially denies knowing about Barrett because of their previous homosexual relations. Barrett eventually chooses suicide over disclosing the affair and Farr guiltily takes a personal interest in locating the blackmailer. He discovers that Barrett was not the only one being blackmailed, and Barrett must decide between exposing his homosexuality and threatening his career or challenging the legal system that decreed homosexuality a criminal offence and bringing Barrett’s blackmailers to justice. Screenplay by Janet Green and John McCormick. Cast also includes Sylvia Syms, Dennis Price, Anthony Nicholls and Peter McEnery.

results.title: The Card
results.creator_credit: Clive Donner, Ronald Neame, John Bryan and British Film-Makers Limited
results.brief_description: Edward Henry Machin (Alec Guinness), Denry for short, has been determined from youth to master his own fate. He uses his powers of persuasion and deception to cajole his way to fame and fortune, but still manages to remain friends with everyone. Affectionately known as ‘The Card’, Denry’s ultimate coup occurs when he becomes the youngest mayor of his home town of Bursley. Denry is not without female companionship, and his life is influenced by three women; a Countess, a dancing teacher, and the councillor’s daughter. It is through his relationship with these women that his deceptive ways are exposed. Also starring Glynis Johns, Valerie Hobson and Petula Clark. Based on the novel by Arnold Bennett and screenplay by Eric Ambler. Also known as “The Promoter”.
